thread.title: TomTom expects value of automotive deals to fall in 2018

title: TomTom expects value of automotive deals to fall in 2018
text:
April 17, 2018 / 10:01 AM / Updated 10 minutes ago TomTom expects value of automotive deals to fall in 2018 Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
AMSTERDAM (Reuters) - Dutch mapping and navigation company TomTom ( TOM2.AS ) expects the value of possible deals in the automotive industry to fall this year, Chief Executive Harrold Goddijn told shareholders at their annual meeting on Tuesday. FILE PHOTO: TomTom navigation are seen in front of TomTom displayed logo in this illustration taken July 28, 2017. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/File Photo 
“We think the total value of potential customers will be lower than in 2017,” Goddijn said. “What I can’t say is which contracts we think we can win.” 
Goddijn also said it was not possible to forecast the order intake for 2018. Reporting by Toby Sterling; editing by Jason Neely
